abstract: Skype was adding 150,000 new users a day when eBay bought it two years ago, figuring the money would follow. It didn’t — at least not enough.
snippet: Skype was adding 150,000 new users a day when eBay bought it two years ago, figuring the money would follow. It didn’t — at least not enough.
lead_paragraph: As Microsoft mulls putting up to $500 million into Facebook at a $10-billion-plus valuation, it may want to consider the fate of eBay’s adventure with the Internet phone service Skype.

headline.main: EBay’s $4 Billion Lesson in the Value of Hype
